npcs.name: Agamennus
utterances: Looking for anything in particular today?  Well, lets just see what we have for sale in the city then, shall we?
Alright, all right.  I'll see what we have on the market now.  Just hold your horses and I'll be with you in a minute!

npcs.name: Aldrevia Metilla
utterances: Oh, hello there.  Have a seat and make yourself comfortable.
Sure, I have pie.  Cherry, blueberry, and apple.  Can I get you a slice?
A burglar?!  Oh my!  Where?  In my inn?  Have you called for the guard?

A leather cap?  I don't sell them, but I know a man who has one.  His name is Pythus.  Maybe he'll sell you his.  I saw him heading towards Crossroad out in the Commonlands, on the Deathfist Highway.  I suppose he lives out there.  If you see him, tell him I said hello!

npcs.name: Amandio Sepunius
utterances: You're lucky there are witnesses watching us right now.
If you're looking for trouble, I've got a whole fistful of it waiting for you.

npcs.name: Annia Kaeso
utterances: Hello.  Hello.  Welcome.  You look out of place here in Freeport.  Almost as if you were something blown in by the wind or swept ashore by the tide.  No wait.  It was that dream!

npcs.name: Apollonia Vibenius
utterances: Didn't I see your corpse in the alley?  Hmmm ... Maybe it was someone else.
Unless you know of a way to make some quick coin, we have no reason to talk.
I wish those guards would just leave us alone.

npcs.name: Bassam
utterances: My time is too valuable to be spent chatting.
Greetings.  One day I hope everyone bows before my intellect.
Brutes you were and always shall be.
Salutations, dark one.

npcs.name: Boatswain Fomas
utterances: What are you looking at?  This ship is for pirates and cutthroats; lily-livered landlubbers aren't allowed in here!

npcs.name: Caius Brucci
utterances: Fair weather and prosperous harvest to you.  What might I interest you in today?

npcs.name: Caraw Slivermoon
utterances: Can you see the beauty of the open plains?
How could you stand living underground for so long?

npcs.name: Clara Maius
utterances: I've no need for you.

npcs.name: Clodia Laeca
utterances: If you need supplies, you best get 'em now! My wares go quickly. Hurry over, traveler. You mustn't wait! Come now!

npcs.name: Corsair G`kex
utterances: Speak quickly, scoundrel, or step aside, as I have little patience for babbling oafs.  Why do I even waste my time?  Get off our ship, now!

npcs.name: Crilt Browbeat
utterances: Blood, lots of blood on the battlefield.
Sharp teeth, the better to tear flesh with.
Make war not love.
I've lived this long thanks to my ability to kill.
Armor could be useful. But I've never needed it.
The best dreams are the flashbacks of the battlefield.

npcs.name: Diometria Oppius
utterances: You might as well hand your loot to the Coalition of Tradefolke if you ever decide to work for them.
I don't trust the Freeport Militia. Neither should you, mate.
I'd rather be stranded overboard than be converted by the dark beliefs that Dismal Rage preaches.
The Seafury Buccaneers are feared by all others on the open sea. They show no mercy to the dogs that try to sail the sea unprotected.

npcs.name: Edesii
utterances: Are you going to buy anything today or am I just wasting my time?  This isn't a museum display you know!

npcs.name: Elona Shawnasy
utterances: I wonder how fast you can run with one leg.
If I wanted to speak with riff raff like you, you'd know it.
All those rumors about the people I decapitated are false, trust me. I decapitated many more by my count.
No, I didn't say you could look at me or talk to me for that matter.
Did you just speak to me?  You're braver than most.

npcs.name: Erasmo Crane
utterances: Hello, citizen. I'd love to chat, but I'm busy getting my ship ready for a short fishing trip.  If you'll excuse me...

npcs.name: Exmarch
utterances: Yo-ho-ho! Now there be some booty that'll fetch more'n a piece o' eight.
Ye starin' at me glass eye, ye poxy tar?

npcs.name: Ghadah
utterances: I doubt there is anyone in this city more intelligent than myself.
I have no patience for someone with such a limited mind.

npcs.name: Glycon Duronius
utterances: Ah!  Another test subject ... Er... I mean to say, another adventurer!
Through the advances in modern magic, anything is possible.
No, no, no!!!  That will never work!  The person still needs to breathe, don't they?  Don't they?
My work would be so much further along if the voices would stop.
For the last time, gnomes didn't make Luclin explode!  We would have gone with disintegration.
How many times must I say it?  Acid first, then the eyeballs, not the other way around!
I must find a wall before I lose this thought!
I will prove to them that I'm not mad!  If I have to kill everyone of them to prove it, I will!
So far, I have found kerrans to have only one life, not nine.  I insist on finding the other eight!
It is said there is more than one way to skin a cat.  My research proves that saying correct.

npcs.name: Hrenga Heartcrush
utterances: Gotta nail clothes onto body or I forget to wear them.
Sometimes I sneak into houses and hide under the bed.
So many things to kill me, dont know where to start.

npcs.name: Kaeso Polluvius
utterances: You looking for someone?
Never heard of him.  Say, interested in some grog?  Fresh in from down south.  Real cheap.
Nominus sent you?  What do I care?  I don't owe him anything! Who does he think he is?  I'm not risking my neck for anyone's sake!

Ok, fine.  Yeah, he comes around here every once and a while.  Keeps to himself so I don't bother him.  What he does away from my docks don't concern me.  I hear he finds most of his marks down at Aldrevia's place.
That's right, down at the Sailing Keg.  Aldrevia might have some information for you, but I doubt it.  She's not all there, if you get what I'm sayin'.

npcs.name: Lathergust
utterances: I'm a complete failure.  I'll never get that vegetation experiment to work right!

npcs.name: Lavic N'Gam
utterances: Yeah, you struck me as gutter trash.  Listen closely, for I don't plan on repeating myself: I have several assignments right now, but I don't have the time to take care of them all.  This is where you come in.

I just told you, you fool!  I need a meat bag to get out there and do the clumsy work while I'm doing the important parts.  You're already beginning to irritate me, trash.  Do you want to see some action or not? I'm sure I can find other refuse around here willing to work for me.

The assignment requires you to do some foot work, and if you're lucky, a little more.  Judging by the way you look, I doubt this is too much to ask of you.  But, if you do return, I'll pay you.  Now, are you in or not?

Then here's what you need to do:  Go to the Commonlands and search around the Crossroads area for a guy named Gyberg Thizweald.  He's a farmer who possesses a special ring. You bring me back that ring, and I'll pay you handsomely.

npcs.name: Lucilla Quietus
utterances: Either buy something or get out of the way!

npcs.name: Lucius Wavedancer
utterances: Good day, <player name>.  What brings you here this fine day?

npcs.name: Mac Windstreaker
utterances: Watch yerself, this city can be rough.
Straying a bit, are we?
Hah! New around these parts?

npcs.name: Marauder Kindolus
utterances: What filth is this before me?  I've a schedule to keep and no time to associate with common trash.

npcs.name: Nipius Malchus
utterances: Hail to you as well.  Forgive me if we've met before...  I'm a little distracted.  I've more custom orders for armor then I've the tradesmen to match.

The armor makers of the city are working on a new, cheaper type of armor.  To make the gear they need armadillo hides and lots of them.  Go and bring me the carcasses of the filthy beasts.  You'll find them living outside the city in the Commonlands.

npcs.name: Pamoja
utterances: I am a kindly master, just so long as you remember your place.
I'd kill to know what the overlord has in that citadel!
I can purr my way out of anything.
Deep down, we're all motivated by the same urges.  I just have the courage to live by them.

npcs.name: Pavel
utterances: Do you ever get the feeling someone is watching you?
Hey!  A deal is a deal.  Until a better one comes along.
If winning isn't everything, why do we keep score?
I know where I've been, cause I'm always watching my back.

npcs.name: Sasha
utterances: It's not true that the kerra always land on their feet.
Risk is part of the game, play it for all it's worth.
That rat snitch better watch her back tonight.

npcs.name: Sergeant Nominus
utterances: Hail, citizen.  If you have something to report then speak up.  Otherwise, move along.
Hmmm ... perhaps you can help me.  I'm trying to track down a rogue who's preying upon the fisherman and clergy folk here in South Freeport.  His name is Pythus.

Several of my guards have been ordered to other parts of the city.  Since my requests for reinforcements have gone ignored, I don't have the men to track down the rogue. But at the same time, they tell me I have to find this Pythus or else.  I don't know how much longer I can put up with this!
I need you to follow our leads and track down Pythus.  Once you find him, make sure he never works again.  You bring me Pythus' cap, and I'll pay you in gold.  Deal?

Good. I'll tell you what I know.  A friend of mine told me he saw Pythus lingering near the docks.  Kaeso Polluvius is one of the caretakers.  Go find Kaeso Polluvius, one of the caretakers. Tell him Nominus sent you.  He owes me a favor, so you should be able to learn something from him.

npcs.name: Sicangu Wi
utterances: Good day, <player name>.  What brings you here this fine day?

npcs.name: Sidonius Baro
utterances: Be careful what you touch in here.  Your liable to kill us all!
Poison testers, it's been my biggest seller for the past several months.  Of course poison was a close second.
I need to get some eye of griffon, a bears paw, the heart of an innocent man.  That'll be tough in this city!
Let me guess, your looking for poison right?

npcs.name: Squab Kalina
utterances: Ha!The life of a free trader is not all fun and games, you know!  We Seafury Buccaneers have a responsibility to guard the waterways in the name of the Overlord!  It's a responsibility we take seriously.

npcs.name: Taba Curhunter
utterances: It's interesting how Ratonga always find their way around the maze-like corridors of Temple Street.
I have no time to waste on safety measures.
Only an amateur would bother worrying about ethics!
Whatever am I going to do with two hundred bottles of leftover acid?  Aha!  The sewers!

npcs.name: Theodorus Volcatius
utterances: The Seafury Buccaneers dominate the high seas. There is no competition, matey.
I don't trust the Freeport Militia. Neither should you, mate.
The Dismal Rage is hideous I tell you. I always get the shivers when I pass by them.

npcs.name: Trtsin
utterances: Greetings, <player name>.  What brings you to the docks today?

npcs.name: Urak Eyegouge
utterances: OWW!!  Head hurts when I do that thing with my brain!  OW!!
Me likes it when they are scared.  It tastes better that way.
You can't eat money. Then why people care about it so much?
I am like fisherman.  I lets you live then catch you later, yes.

npcs.name: Valokis
utterances: Hello there, kind adventurer.  My merchandise carries the seal of the Overlord himself!  Go ahead, take a look!
In spite of the cost of living, it's still quite a popular item.

npcs.name: Vlenka Nightstalker
utterances: Do you honestly believe I would speak with someone like you?

npcs.name: Voula Redeye
utterances: In the heat of battle is the only way to die.
Drinking the blood of your enemy only makes you stronger.
I use fear to kill my enemies.
Armor is just an extension of my skin.
